Key Match Events: Coby White scored 28 points but the Chicago Bulls lost to the Utah Jazz 135-126.
The Chicago Bulls gave up the most points to any opponent thus far this season to a Jazz team that came in averaging a league-worst 99.8 points per game.
Post-Match Reflections: Matt, Big Dave, and Will Perdue discussed the factors that led to the Bulls' loss.
Will Gottlieb joined from the United Center to offer his thoughts on the game and insights from the Postgame locker room.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Utah Jazz won their first game of the season.
Lauri Markkanen and Jordan Clarkson were both missing from the Utah Jazz lineup.
